strategies.title: One hand alt
strategies.description: For this strategy you alt the thinner notes with one hand.
strategies.author: Fewcher

strategies.title: Overlapping alt
strategies.description: For this strategy you alternate between left and right, starting with left and overlapping your hands when necessary.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: Overhand
strategies.description: For this strategy you overhand with left hand and hit the notes in the middle with right hand.
strategies.author: Fewcher

strategies.title: Multifinger
strategies.description: For this strategy you place your fingers at the intuitive position for 4k and hit notes accordingly.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: Fast taps
strategies.description: For this strategy you use two fingers to quickly tap the hold notes. It's important to release the holds the second you tap them, and this can be easier to do with only two fingers.
strategies.author: Fewcher

strategies.title: Multifinger
strategies.description: For this strategy you place your fingers at the intuitive position for 4k and hit notes accordingly. It's important to release the holds the second you tap them.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: Three fingers
strategies.description: For this strategy you use three fingers on right hand for the first holds. It's important to release the holds the second you tap them, and using three fingers on one hand could make this easier. As gold notes have a more lenient Perfect judgement, the strategy is only used for the first Jump-Stairs.
strategies.author: TheLetterP

strategies.title: Overhand alt
strategies.description: For this strategy you alternate tapping with left and right hand every beat, overhanding where necessary.
strategies.author: Fewcher

strategies.title: One hand alt
strategies.description: For this strategy you alt with one hand and tap with the other, swapping where necessary.
strategies.author: TheLetterP
